nodes.name: RenProxyAdmin

attributes.name: RenProxyAdmin

devdoc.details: Proxies restrict the proxy's owner from calling functions from the delegate contract logic. The ProxyAdmin contract allows single account to be the governance address of both the proxy and the delegate contract logic.

changeProxyAdmin(address,address).details: Changes the admin of a proxy.

params.newAdmin: Address to transfer proxy administration to.

getProxyAdmin(address).details: Returns the admin of a proxy. Only the admin can query it.
getProxyAdmin(address).return: The address of the current admin of the proxy.

getProxyImplementation(address).details: Returns the current implementation of a proxy. This is needed because only the proxy admin can query it.
getProxyImplementation(address).return: The address of the current implementation of the proxy.

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

upgrade(address,address).details: Upgrades a proxy to the newest implementation of a contract.

upgradeAndCall(address,address,bytes).details: Upgrades a proxy to the newest implementation of a contract and forwards a function call to it. This is useful to initialize the proxied contract.

params.data: Data to send as msg.data in the low level call. It should include the signature and the parameters of the function to be called, as described in https://solidity.readthedocs.io/en/v0.4.24/abi-spec.html#function-selector-and-argument-encoding.

devdoc.title: RenProxyAdmin

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing to ownership will leave the contract without an owner. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.
